items.headline: Johnson & Johnson’s pipeline strategy: What does 2026 have in store for the big pharma?
items.preview: Johnson & Johnson is focusing on oncology and immunology as it navigates market pressures.
items.article:
As 2026 gets underway, Johnson & Johnson (J&J) is navigating an inflection point that involves balancing a maturing internal pipeline with evolving external pressures on pricing, policy, and dealmaking. The company has set a positive outlook for the coming year, projecting sales between $100 billion and $101 billion, up from $94.2 billion last year.

Why this matters: J&J's strategy reflects a prioritization of core therapeutic strengths, particularly in oncology, where it aims to become the number one company in the field. The success of its cancer portfolio, including drugs like Darzalex and Tecvayli, is crucial for offsetting losses from its immunology segment, especially following the loss of exclusivity for Stelara. J&J's approach to diversifying its pipeline and focusing on innovative therapies could significantly impact its market position in 2026.

items.headline: AstraZeneca looks to China for obesity drug candidates
items.preview: AstraZeneca is exploring opportunities in China for its obesity drug candidates.
items.article:
AstraZeneca is focusing on China as a potential market for its obesity drug candidates. The company is looking to expand its portfolio in response to the growing demand for obesity treatments in the region.

Why this matters: With obesity rates rising globally, AstraZeneca's strategic move to tap into the Chinese market could enhance its competitive edge in the obesity treatment sector. This initiative reflects the company's commitment to addressing significant health challenges and leveraging emerging markets for growth.

sources.name: STAT Biotech news: Market-moving coverage of drug development

items.headline: Biomanagement Strategies Against Phytopathogens: A Review
items.preview: A review discusses innovative biomanagement strategies to combat phytopathogens in agriculture.
items.article:
In recent years, the agricultural sector has faced challenges due to phytopathogens that threaten crop yields and food security. Researchers Riaz et al. explore biomanagement strategies emphasizing sustainable practices to combat these pathogens.

Why this matters: The review highlights the potential of using beneficial microorganisms and plant-derived natural compounds as alternatives to chemical pesticides. This shift towards biomanagement could lead to more environmentally friendly agricultural practices, ensuring long-term viability and resilience against climate change impacts.

items.headline: Exploring Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation for Autism Treatment
items.preview: A study investigates the potential of TMS as a treatment for autism spectrum disorders.
items.article:
Researchers have examined the use of transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) as a novel treatment for autism spectrum disorders (ASD). This non-invasive technique aims to stimulate brain regions associated with cognitive and emotional functions.

Why this matters: The findings suggest that TMS could enhance cognitive flexibility and emotional regulation in individuals with ASD, offering a new therapeutic avenue for those unresponsive to traditional interventions. This research could pave the way for innovative treatments that improve the quality of life for individuals with autism.

items.headline: Microstructural profiles of the human superficial white matter and their associations to cortical geometry and connectivity
items.preview: A study develops a framework to analyze the microstructure of superficial white matter in the brain.
items.article:
This study investigates the superficial white matter (SWM) beneath the cortical mantle, aiming to understand its role in brain connectivity and function. Using advanced imaging techniques, researchers analyzed variations in SWM organization and its correlation with cortical geometry.

Why this matters: The insights gained from this research could enhance our understanding of brain structure-function relationships and contribute to the development of new approaches in neuroscience, particularly in understanding neurological disorders.
